column4: Hello, I just installed 8.04 on my laptop (no other OS installed).  I had some pictures and other files backed up on a USB stick, I tried to drag them onto my “documents” folder, but it says I don't have enough space – only 5 MB left free on that drive.  Did I do the partitions incorrectly?  I'm sure its a total newb question but any help would be much appreciated.
go to System > Administration > System monitor, then click on the File Systems tab to check how much space you have left

thank you.  here is what i get.  device gvfs-fuse-daemon ... /home/ubuntu/.gvfs total=251.5 MB free=30MB (88% used) ... but I have an 80 gig hard drive! :)  in System - Administration - Partition Editor, there is a /dev/sda1/ "filesystem - ext3" and that is marked as "boot" in Gparted
does it say (in Gparted) how big the ext3 partition is?
thank you.  yes.  ext3 reads 73.09 GiB, 2.64 Used. 70.45 unused, flagged as "boot"
have you tried the "disk usage analyzer" to see what, if anything, is taking up all that space?
thank you.  i have not tried that.  will load it up presently.  seems strange that GParted reports ext3 with 70 GiB free, but "System Monitor" does not list it?
when I "Scan Filesystem" in "Disk Usage Analyzer", it says my total filesystem capacity is 2.1 GiB and 1 GiB free... weird?!
that is weird, open a terminal and run the command "df -h" see if that outputs anything useful
sorry got kicked off for a second
its alright, did you get the message i sent you about "df -h" ?
i am still here, i ran df -h, it gave me 9 lines
tmpfs, 252M 16M used mounted on /lib/modeules/2.6.24-16-generic/volatile
it says the same thing for the second line
is there anything that says "/dev/sd" ?

there is a /dev/sdc1 1.9 GiB, 1GiB free, I think this is the pen drive with my pictures and documents on it... I should also say that so far I have always had to boot via a (different) pen drive, since I couldn't install from CD (physical damage to CD-ROM)
so when you installed it you booted it from a pen drive?

yes, since my CD-ROM doesn't work I put the install files on the USB and followed the instructions on pendrivelinux.com, i did not want to have to boot from a pen drive each time.  However, when I set my BIOS to boot from my internal HD first, it hangs on a black screen with "GRUB _"
the only way for me to boot is to have the pen drive, and in the pen drive menu, i choose "boot from hard drive" .. and then it works.  its kind of annoying, and i would like to skip this extra step
i'm thinking you're running from the pen drive and not an actual install on your hard drive. i'm afraid i dont know how to help you out with that problem
i don't have any documents or files that i really need on here (only been a few days now), maybe I should just try a fresh install?
that would probably the easiest fix
off to try that now, thank you for your help and patience today
you're welcome
